channel.title: NPR Topics: National
channel.description: NPR coverage of national news, U.S. politics, elections, business, arts, culture, health and science, and technology. Subscribe to the NPR Nation RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: How the Minneapolis killings look from Trump country
item.description: The shooting of Alex Pretti and Renee Macklin Good by federal agents in Minneapolis have enraged many people across the country. NPR wanted to know what supporters of President Trump's immigration policy think about the shootings.
item.content:encoded:
The shooting of Alex Pretti and Renee Macklin Good by federal agents in Minneapolis have enraged many people across the country. NPR wanted to know what supporters of President Trump's immigration policy think about the shootings.

(Image credit: Adam Gray)
item.dc:creator: Frank Langfitt

item.title: A snow-starved January is bringing economic pain to the U.S. West
item.description: Colorado and Utah are reporting their lowest snowpacks in recorded history. Skier visits at major resorts are way down. Without snow to refresh reservoirs, water managers are sounding alarms.
item.content:encoded: Colorado and Utah are reporting their lowest snowpacks in recorded history. Skier visits at major resorts are way down. Without snow to refresh reservoirs, water managers are sounding alarms.
item.dc:creator: Kirk Siegler

item.title: The view of the Minneapolis shooting from Trump country
item.description: NPR's Frank Langfitt traveled to a county on Maryland's Eastern Shore to hear what supporters of President Trump think about the killing of Alex Pretti by federal agents in Minneapolis.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Frank Langfitt traveled to a county on Maryland's Eastern Shore to hear what supporters of President Trump think about the killing of Alex Pretti by federal agents in Minneapolis.
item.dc:creator: Frank Langfitt

item.title: The FBI conducts a search at the Fulton County election office in Georgia
item.description: The FBI would not clarify whether the action is tied to the 2020 election, but last month the Department of Justice announced it's suing Fulton County for records related to the election.
item.content:encoded:
The FBI would not clarify whether the action is tied to the 2020 election, but last month the Department of Justice announced it's suing Fulton County for records related to the election.

(Image credit: John Bazemore)
item.dc:creator: Stephen Fowler

item.title: Trump's National Guard deployments could cost over $1 billion this year, CBO projects
item.description: The operation in Washington, D.C. alone is projected to cost upwards of $660 million if it runs through the end of this year as expected, according to new data released by the nonpartisan Congressional Budget Office.
item.content:encoded:
The operation in Washington, D.C. alone is projected to cost upwards of $660 million if it runs through the end of this year as expected, according to new data released by the nonpartisan Congressional Budget Office.

(Image credit: Al Drago)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: Minnesotans remain skeptical as tensions as state-federal tensions appear to ease
item.description: A preliminary government review contradicts the White House's initial narrative of the shooting of 37-year-old Alex Pretti in Minneapolis. The review comes as officials work to ease tensions.
item.content:encoded: A preliminary government review contradicts the White House's initial narrative of the shooting of 37-year-old Alex Pretti in Minneapolis. The review comes as officials work to ease tensions.
item.dc:creator: Meg Anderson

item.title: CBP has a history of excessive force. Critics say they were unprepared for Minnesota
item.description: Experts say federal immigration agents' skills are a dangerous mismatch for urban settings such as the Twin Cities
item.content:encoded:
Experts say federal immigration agents' skills are a dangerous mismatch for urban settings such as the Twin Cities

(Image credit: Jen Golbeck/AP)
item.dc:creator: Martin Kaste

item.title: Bystander videos have long shaped public opinion of police violence
item.description: Bystander videos have shaped public perception for decades. The ability to now spread video widely can lead to real-time access and transparency, but experts say videos can't tell the full story.
item.content:encoded:
Bystander videos have shaped public perception for decades. The ability to now spread video widely can lead to real-time access and transparency, but experts say videos can't tell the full story.

(Image credit: Jason Redmond)
item.dc:creator: Ava Berger

item.title: To keep AI out of her classroom, this high school English teacher went analog
item.description: Forth Worth teacher Chanea Bond says sticking with pen and paper keeps generative artificial intelligence out of her American literature classes.
item.content:encoded: Forth Worth teacher Chanea Bond says sticking with pen and paper keeps generative artificial intelligence out of her American literature classes.
item.dc:creator: Lee V. Gaines

item.title: 3 generations of women in one family show how choices on motherhood have changed
item.description: In one family, three generations of American women explore how choices around becoming mothers have changed at the same time the U.S. birth rate has dropped.
item.content:encoded:
In one family, three generations of American women explore how choices around becoming mothers have changed at the same time the U.S. birth rate has dropped.

(Image credit: Nicole Buchanan for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Sarah McCammon
